org.kynosarges.tektosyne.graph

Class NodeArc

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kynosarges.tektosyne.graph.NodeArc

  • public final class NodeArc
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the visibility of a Graph node from a source node. Encapsulates data required by the Visibility line-of-sight algorithm. The Graph node that defines the NodeArc and the source node that defines the viewpoint are not stored in the NodeArc.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double distance
      The positive distance from the source node to the NodeArc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int isObscured(NodeArc arc)
      Determines whether the current NodeArc completely obscures the specified instance, or vice versa.

      Gets the starting angle of the NodeArc.

      Gets the visible fraction of the NodeArc.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • distance

        public final double distance
        The positive distance from the source node to the NodeArc. Measured in world coordinates from the Graph.getWorldLocation(T) result for the source node to the nearest vertex of the Graph.getWorldRegion(T) result for the graph node that defines the tangential arc.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public double start()
        Gets the starting angle of the NodeArc. Measured clockwise in radians from the x-axis, assuming y-coordinates increase upward.
        Returns:
        the starting angle of the NodeArc

      • sweep

        public double sweep()
        Gets the positive sweep angle of the NodeArc. Measured clockwise in radians, assuming y-coordinates increase upward. Never zero or negative in published NodeArc instances, but set to zero for some instances internally used by the Visibility algorithm.
        Returns:
        the positive sweep angle of the NodeArc

      • visibleFraction

        public double visibleFraction()
        Gets the visible fraction of the NodeArc. Defaults to one for a newly created NodeArc. May be inaccurate if it is smaller than the current Visibility.threshold(), as the Visibility algorithm stops updating a NodeArc as soon as it is considered obscured.
        Returns:
        the fraction of the sweep() angle that remains unobscured, from zero to one

      • isObscured

        public int isObscured(NodeArc arc)
        Determines whether the current NodeArc completely obscures the specified instance, or vice versa. Takes the distance of both instances into account to determine which instance obscures the other, if any.
        Parameters:
        arc - the other NodeArc to examine
        Returns:
        zero if neither NodeArc completely obscures the other; less than zero if arc completely obscures this instance; greater than zero if this instance completely obscures arc
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if arc is null
